articles.title: About Me
articles.description: I am Francesca, a junior at GW majoring in International Affairs and minoring in Journalism and Sustainability. I'm interested in the intersections between sustainability, international affairs, and communications. I'm taking a data journalism course and learning how to code with R to better improve my data visualization and communication skills.

articles.title: Experience
articles.description: Below is a highlight of my resume and former work experiences.
articles.contents:
FRANCESCA EDRALIN
fedralin@gwu.edu | 732-788-4520 | LinkedIn
EDUCATION
The George Washington University (Expected Graduation: December 2021)
Freshman Year: Elizabeth J. Somers Women’s Leadership Program, International Politics Cohort
Bachelor of Arts in International Affairs with minors in Sustainability and Journalism/Mass Communication
Cumulative GPA: 3.77 (Dean’s List: Fall 2019, Spring 2020, Fall 2020)
WORK EXPERIENCE
STATE DEPARTMENT: VSFS Research Intern (August 2020-Present)
Works in small team to conduct research on environmental conflicts, community displacement, and human rights concerns for the Bureau of Oceans and International Environmental and Scientific Affairs, currently focusing on the Philippines and Indonesia
Develops 300-slide presentations per country on background, policies, specific case studies, and look-fors, which I help deliver as presentations to Embassies, State and USAID officials, and other key stakeholders
Analyzes and summarizes trends to help inform policy recommendations to Embassies and stakeholders
PULITZER CENTER ON CRISIS REPORTING: Intern (December 2020-Present)
Supports the Rainforest Journalism Fund (RJF), the Pulitzer Center’s recent investment in international climate reporting
Works with researchers, journalists and media contacts in the Amazon, Congo Basin, and Southeast Asia regions to produce on-the-ground stories on underreported environmental and human rights topics ranging from community resilience, migration, and ecosystem restoration
Tracks stories’ audience reach and influence on policy change using platforms like Salesforce and Coveragebooks, and shares stories to relevant organizations and media points for further publication
INTERNATIONAL FOOD POLICY RESEARCH INSTITUTE: Communications Intern (September 2020-December 2020)
Wrote articles on key research findings related to the fields of climate adaptation and migration, rural community resilience, and food security, collaborating with IFPRI’s research experts
Aided in the logistical planning and execution of weekly panel events, including registration, live-tweeting, managing Q&A, and writing event summary posts
Drafted and planned social media content to announce groundbreaking research, articles, or panel events to social media audiences
USAID GLOBAL DEVELOPMENT LAB: Innovation Intern (May 2020-August 2020)
Conducted research on various international development issues (including food security, environment, refugees, gender inequality, agriculture, clean water) to support key messaging towards the Lab’s various projects and competitions
Created communication materials (presentations, social media posts, blogs etc.) to perform outreach to potential stakeholders and present the Lab’s work to key audiences
Reviewed and provided feedback on project proposals for various Lab competitions, including the BetterTogether Challenge (which focuses on the Venezuela refugee crisis) and RISE (which focuses on addressing gender inequality in environmental programming)
SUSTAINABLE GW: Community Engagement Assistant (September 2019-Present)
Coordinates and executes the GW Sustainability department’s events on campus and online, including panels and annual Summit
Serves as a student liaison for students interested in the Sustainability minor and environmental academic programming to SustainableGW
Manages SustainableGW’s “Sustainability Snapshot” feature on website, covering the various events, people, and opportunities on campus that contribute to the local sustainability movement
COUNCIL ON FOREIGN RELATIONS: Global Communications and Media Relations Intern (January 2020-May 2020)
Ran press registration at weekly on-the-record events about foreign policy issues
Conducted research and built targeted press outreach lists for books, newsletters, podcasts, and other reports using databases like Cision and CRM
Attended high-level meetings and compiled key quotes and points for promotional purposes
FUNDACIÓN BIOSFERA: Research/Advocacy Intern (June 1019-July 2019)
Interned at the top environmental NGO in La Plata, Buenos Aires to conduct research and help draft reports on environmental issues facing the Buenos Aires community 
Created digital advocacy campaigns and ran all social media accounts
LEADERSHIP EXPERIENCE
GW UNICEF: President (September 2018-Present)
Previously served as Freshman Ambassador, Public Relations Chair, and Vice President
Leads operations of executive board and the execution of programming and events, runs social media accounts and newsletter
Fosters partnerships with other school organizations and represents organization to school administration
GW UN360 PROGRAM (September 2020-Present)
A GW program that selects 25 student leaders out of 200 applicants to explore the United Nations and their partner organizations 
Attends weekly site visits, lectures, and workshops to deepen understanding of the UN’s mission and work in sustainable development
Connects with professionals in various fields to better understand the work within various sustainable development organizations
THINKOCEAN: Director of Global Outreach (January 2019-September 2020)
Led the Global Outreach Team of ThinkOcean, a network of youth-led environmental organizations from over 20 countries
Planned and executed online advocacy initiatives, as well as presented ThinkOcean’s work at international panels and advocacy events
Targeted new audiences for outreach and partnerships, as well as maintained current partnerships with sponsors
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
2021 Comcast/NBCUniversal Sustainable Storytelling Fellow
Planet Forward StoryFest Winner, 2021
Onero Institute’s “Foreign Affairs with Future Leaders” Distinguished Speaker, 2020
GW Women’s Leadership Program Humphries Award, 2020
Taco Bell Live Más Scholar, 2018, 2019, 2020
EF Tours Global Citizen Scholarship Recipient and Innovation Village Winner, 2017
